title: JSX is inconsistently in rendering SVG text-anchor attribute between React DOM and ReactTestRenderer
body:
I think there is a bug in the behaviour of outputting the following text between ReactDOM and ReactTestRenderer.

```
<svg>
            <circle r="20%" cx="50%" cy="50%"></circle>
            <text textAnchor="middle" x="40%" y="50%">no hyphen</text>
            <text text-anchor="middle" x="60%" y="50%">with hyphen</text>
 </svg>
```

**What is the current behavior?**

It seems that when rendering the component using a jest Snapshot (which uses ReactTestRenderer) produces the following is output.

![Jest HTML output](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s399/sh/ddf1cb51-723e-418f-b504-7d1670629331/787d136f056134af/res/9ffbd86b-a61a-46b2-9dd2-ac967e8488b2/skitch.png?resizeSmall&width=832)
```
<svg
  height="400"
  width="400">
  <circle
    cx="50%"
    cy="50%"
    fill="#bada55"
    r="200" />
  <text
    textAnchor="middle"
    x="50%"
    y="25%">
    no hyphen
  </text>
  <text
    text-anchor="middle"
    x="50%"
    y="75%">
    with hyphen
  </text>
</svg>
```
When I run the same code in the browser using JSX compiled to javascript and put through ReactJS, I get the following output - see [example](https://jsfiddle.net/zfst39e0/)

![Rendered HTML output](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s399/sh/02ca80cc-9249-4606-90de-e144555676e6/001782857fa5964b/res/06d4ba40-c37d-4ccc-9340-a7d1c2eb1a57/skitch.png?resizeSmall&width=832)


```
<svg data-reactroot="" width="400" height="400">
  <circle fill="#bada55" r="200" cx="50%" cy="50%"></circle>
  <text text-anchor="middle" x="50%" y="25%">no hyphen</text>
  <text x="50%" y="75%">with hyphen</text>
</svg>
```

Clearly the Test renderer is leaving unknown attributes as is, whereas the DOM renderer is altering the camelCase to make them hyphenated.

I'm not sure if I can change my JSX to allow this example to work in both scenarios - a jest-snapshot and ReactJS? If not does the bug lie in the jest snapshot renderer or the ReactJS renderer?

**What is the expected behavior?**

ReactTestRenderer behaves the same as ReactJS.

Of note: here are the version numbers I have been using in my code...

```
"devDependencies": {
    "@types/jest": "^16.0.4",
    "@types/react": "^15.0.1",
    "@types/react-dom": "^0.14.20",
    "@types/react-test-renderer": "^15.4.1",
    "jest": "^18.1.0",
    "jest-cli": "^18.1.0",
    "jest-html": "^1.3.3",
    "react": "^15.4.2",
    "react-test-renderer": "^15.4.2",
    "tslint": "^4.3.1",
    "typescript": "^2.1.5"
  },
```

A brief look through the source code yeilds this line for the reactRenderer...

https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/c78464f8ea9a5b00ec80252d20a71a1482210e57/src/renderers/dom/shared/SVGDOMPropertyConfig.js

I can't find a similar line for the test renderer.
